basics.name: Mengmeng Wang
basics.label: Data Scientist, Engineer, Researcher
basics.summary: A dedicated data scientist and researcher with a multidisciplinary background in electrical engineering, biomedical engineering, and computer science. Experienced in data analysis, machine learning, and large language models.

work.name: Centre for Youth Mental Health, Orygen
work.summary: Worked on data extraction, machine learning models, statistical analysis, and interactive dashboards for mental health service improvements.
highlights: Developed statistical analysis plans and research reports
Built and deployed machine learning pipelines
Collaborated with clinicians, researchers, and policymakers

work.name: The University of Melbourne
work.summary: Delivered tutorials on data processing, machine learning, and signals & systems.
highlights: Taught data wrangling, visualization, NLP, classification, and neural networks
Used Python libraries including Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-Learn

education.institution: Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications

projects.name: EEG Data Analysis in Music Therapy
projects.summary: Analyzed EEG data in music therapy research, including data cleaning, preprocessing, and statistical analysis.

projects.name: Financial Timeseries Processing and Forecast
projects.summary: Performed financial data analysis and timeseries forecasting using machine learning models.

projects.name: Customer Purchasing Behaviors Analysis
projects.summary: Analyzed transaction data to find patterns in customer behavior.

projects.name: Reinforcement Learning and Multi-Armed Bandits (MABs)
projects.summary: Implemented and evaluated reinforcement learning algorithms including UCB and LinUCB.

publications.name: The changing impacts of social determinants on youth mental health in Australia
publications.publisher: The International Journal of Social Psychiatry

publications.name: Correction of induced functional connectivity in filtered resting state fNIRS data
Correction for time-varying signal power in fNIRS connectivity analyses
Motion Artefact Removal in Functional Near-infrared Spectroscopy Signals Based on Robust Estimation
A very low complexity reduced reference video quality metric based on spatio-temporal information selection

volunteer.summary: Mentored Year 11/12 female students interested in science and engineering.
highlights: Encouraged young women to pursue STEM education
